intro: Jambosa versteegii, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and oval, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red berries that are edible. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
